title: Royal Mail: Introducing electric HGVs into our network is a major milestone
summary: Royal Mail has rolled out its first fleet of eight electric Heavy Goods Vehicles (eHGVs) at its Midlands and North West Parcel Hubs. The launch is a major step forward in reducing the company’s carbon emissions by replacing diesel-powered 42-tonne trucks with zero-emission alternatives.

title: Scurri: Shoppers are sending retailers a clear message on AI
summary: New consumer research commissioned by delivery management and post-purchase experience provider Scurri reveals that while 60% believe AI enhances the shopping experience, a striking 81% say they would feel uneasy if AI replaced human jobs in retail and logistics.

summary:
Chinese car exports have beaten challenges from tariffs imposed by the US and EU and are set to hit 6m units this year, a new record, beating more than 5m overseas sales in 2024.

title: Royal Mail rolls out first electric HGV fleet at parcel hubs
summary:
Royal Mail has deployed its first fleet of electric heavy goods vehicles (eHGVs) as part of its plan to cut emissions across its national logistics network and progress toward its 2040 net zero target.

Eight 42 metric ton DAF XD 350E trucks have entered service at the company’s Midlands Parcel Hub in Daventry and its North West Parcel Hub in Warrington. The vehicles will operate on middle-mile routes between parcel hubs and mail centers, running continuously throughout the day.

Continue reading Royal Mail rolls out first electric HGV fleet at parcel hubs at Parcel and Postal Technology International.
